ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organization was formed by the thought and inspiration of the leading legends of our time such as Mahatma Gandhi, Ram Manohar Lohia, Jai Parkash Narain and others to serve the poor strata of the society at large and mainly rural folk of this region. The objectives of the society are to organize and develop capabilities and train rural community to improve their livelihood and sustenance under the socio-economic atmosphere of the day. Empower the women folk by various activities through income generating programmes and to mobilize the public opinion against social evils and check the atrocities on women and exploitation of rural laborers. The organization takes steps to utilize existing resources for improving the health conditions of mother and children and generates public opinion in favor of family planning and â€œSmall Familyâ€ norms. The organization was formed with the main object to promote integrated sustainable development by the people, for the people, of the people and act as a catalyst in bringing about integrated sustainable development to put smile on the face of RURAL INDIA as a result of our efforts we are â€œTRANSFORMING SOCIAL FABRIC SILENTLYâ€.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE ACADEMY (NESA) NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE ACADEMY was established in 1984 by Late Prof. TRC Sinha, its Founder General Secretary and was registered in the year 1988 under the Societies Act XXI of 1960. Presently, its head quarters and office is 206, Raj Tower-1, Alaknanda Community Centre, New Delhi-110019, and registered office at Shiv Puri, Behind A.N. College, Patna 800 023, Bihar. Aims and Objectives Ã˜ To enhance and promote the study of the environmental sciences by encouraging students, scientists, researchers, academicians and members of the Academy for pursuing research on environment and allied areas. Ã˜ To set up Regional/State Chapters for dissemination of information on environment. Ã˜ To motivate and prepare young minds on environmental management. Ã˜ To hold Annual Conference of the Academy. Ã˜ To organise national/international level conferences, symposia, seminars, meetings and workshops on themes of environmental concerns. Ã˜ To publish policy papers, synthesis volumes, proceedings, journals, newsletter, transactions and other publications for the promotion of Environmental Sciences. Various eminent personalities had graced the Academy as its President. The first President of the Academy was Dr. K.C. Bose, Vice-Chancellor of Ranchi University, then Dr. B.S. Attri, Advisor, Ministry of Environment and Forest. Most recently Padmabhushan Dr. S.Z. Qasim was the President of the Academy till June 2015. He was the most renowned marine scientist known for his Antarctica mission in 1981-82. He also served as Secretary of the Deptt. of Ocean Development (now Ministry of Earth Sciences); Member, Planning Commission and Vice-Chancellor, Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi. Currently Prof. Javed Ahmad, Prof. (Retd. Dean, Faculty of Science), Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi, is the President of the Academy. The Academy has Chapters in almost all the States of the country as well as regional chapters in various countries which support activities of the Academy to promote awareness, research and publications related to environmental issues. Presently, we have chapters in 15 countries, including USA, Canada, Finland, Russia, China, Brazil, Taiwan, Kuwait, etc. It has organised many activities, with financial support from the Ministry of Environment & Forests, Department of Science and Technology, Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, Indian National Science Academy, Indian Council of Medical Research, Ministry of Earth Sciences, and Department of Biotechnology, regularly for over 28 years. The Academy regularly organises Annual Conferences in prominent centres of India encompassing important topics related to the environment â€” 24 conferences and symposia on more than 31 topics in different parts of the country. All the Annual Conferences were inaugurated by eminent scientists of the country, Vice-chancellors, Governors, Chief Ministers, Senior Cabinet Ministers of the Union and respective State Governments, etc. Activities such as organisation of Eco-clubs in different Schools of Delhi, Eco-development Camps, celebration of Environment Day and a number of Symposia were organised with the financial support of Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India. The Academy has also organised more than 50 training programmes in different schools of Delhi on Disaster Management, sponsored by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. The issue of noise pollution, in particular, was taken up by the Academy that received appreciation from the Government of Delhi which subsequently passed an Act on NOISE POLLUTION. Similarly, the CLEAN AND GREEN DELHI slogan was popularised by the Academy through its various activities and publications. The Academy celebrated its 25th year of its inception by organising an International Conference on Environment and Human Health on November 28-29, 2012 at the Indian National Science Academy, New Delhi. The Conference was inaugurated by Dr. Krishnaswamy Kasturirangan, Member, Planning Commission. In order to bring awareness amongst the masses at the grassroots, the Academy organises activities by DISTRICT ENVIRONMENTAL CENTRES in various districts of the country. More than 45 Centres have already been started and many more are coming up.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Food processing: Organisation has obtained a license for the production and marketing from Govt. of India. 5236 women in the three districts are employed under the food processing unit and they are earning Rs.4000- 5000 per month. Promotion of Dairy, Goatry and Poultry:893 families for Dairy, 3013 families for Goatry and 2256 families for poultry have been provided support for establishing independent very small enterprise at home Hand craft and idol making: 516 artists have been trained by NBSKPK, who are earning from this. Khadi: 218 Katin have been trained by NBSKPK, who are earning from this. Agriculture promotion: Floriculture: 272 small farmers have adopted flower cultivation in portion of their land Group farming: A group of 4522 farmers were given orientation and encouraged for groups farming so that they can take bigger farms on lease Training on SRI method and Organic farming: about 1823 farmers have been oriented on SRI methods of plantation of rice as well as use of organic manures in cultivation Establishment of seed banks: 4 Formation of farmers club: 56 Women & Men farmer clubs with 20-30 members each

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The National Rural Health Mission was launched for the period 2005 to 2012 with the goal of improving the availability of and access to quality health care for people especially for those residing in rural areas, the poor women and children. Community Based Monitoring and Planning was introduced as important component in order to ensure that the services reach those for whom they are meant. It was an outcome of consistent effort taken by Jan Swasthya Abhiyan. Community Based Monitoring is also seen as an important aspect of promoting accountability & community led action in the field of health. The monitoring process also includes outreach services, public health facilities and the referral system. It is assumed that, the most important input on what, where and how health services are needed and should be provided or improved can be given most efficiently by the users/ beneficiaries of the services themselves. Community based monitoring places people at the centre of the process. Community Based organizations peoples movements non government organizations and Panchayat representatives monitor demand need coverage access quality effectiveness, behavior and presence of health care personnel at service points, possible denial of care and negligence as well as directly give feedback about the functioning of public health services, including giving inputs for improvement. This has enabled peoples participation in monitoring health resources and direct dialogue with health officials. The platform ensures accountable as well as transparent practices. The Neha Gramin Mahila Vikas Smiti has taken the responsibility to implement this Project as a Block NGO at Kauakol Block in Nawada District. As per objective of the program organization have been formed 33 numbers of village level planning and monitoring committee in 5 panchayat and also one Block level Planning and Monitoring Committee. During the accomplishment the organization has, organized community based Jan Samvad at Kauakol Block.
